column2:
# Create distribution visualization
tracts_with_data %>%
  st_drop_geometry() %>%
  filter(vulnerable == TRUE) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = dist_to_hospital)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "#08306b", color = "white") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 15, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", size = 1) +
  labs(
    title = "Distance to Nearest Hospital for Vulnerable Tracts",
    x = "Distance (miles)",
    y = "Number of Vulnerable Tracts",
    caption = "Vulnerable tracts: bottom 25% in median income & top 25% in population 65+, relative to the rest of PA\nDashed line shows 15-mile threshold used to define underserved.\nThere is a clustering of tracts with relatively close hospital access (<15 miles) and a very long tail beyond the 15 mile cutoff."
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
